column1: 09-12-1951 Born in Schenectady, New York.  Mother had 4 children before him, all who she
0 gave up for adoption.  After him she had another child, girl, who had brain
damage.  She kept the girl and gave Stano away.
N/A Was assessed by a team of psychologists, physicians, and social workers to not
13 be fit for adoption due to such severe neglect.
months - was functioning at animalistic level
- would play with his own feces
Adopted by Eugene and Norma Stano.  His name was changed from Paul to
- Norma was a social worker and Eugene was a Manager for a large corporation
N/A Wet the bed until around age 10
N/A During adolescence was reported to have trouble relating to kids his age and
typically stayed to his self.  During this time he was the target for bullies and
1965-66 Arrested for falsely sounding a fire alarm, and then for throwing rocks at cars
N/A Enrolled in military school by parents to try and fix his problems.  It failed and he
started stealing money from fellow his peers.
1967 Family moved to Norristown, PA.  Started skipping school and stealing money
1968-1971 Continued stealing money from friends and family.  Paid track team to run
17-20 behind him so he could finish first.  Paid them with money he stole from his dad.
Repeatedly failed classes in high school.  Repeated at least three grade levels.
1972-1973 Received high school diploma.  Soon after he enrolled himself in a computer
school and moved into a hotel.  Graduated and started working at a local hospital
but fired shortly after for stealing money from co-workers.  Then moved back in
with parents after moving from job to job.
Early Moved to New Jersey and met a retarded girl.  Started dating her and got her
1970’s pregnant.  Father came after him with a gun and demanded he pay for an
abortion.  He agreed, after which he started heavy drinking and drug use.  Later
his parents wanted him to move to Ormond Beach, FL so they could take care of
his grandmother.  So he moved to FL.  While in FL moved from job to job.
Mostly was fired for being late or stealing.

column3: Janine Ligotino (WF, 19) and Ann Arceneaux (WF, 17) stabbed to death inGainesville, Florida
Barbara Anne Bauer (WF, 17) strangled to death in New Smyrna Beach, FL
Continued alcohol and drug abuse.  Job hopped, usually fired for tardiness, theft,or not showing up.
Cathy Lee Scharf (WF, 17) strangled to death in Brevard County, FL
Barbara Ann Baur and a unidentified woman found dead
Stopped using drugs and drinking.  Started dating a 22 year old hairstylist.
Nancy Jean Heard (WF, 24) strangled to death in Port Orange, FL
Diana Lynn Valleck (WF, 18) is shot to death in Tampa, FL
Susan Basile (WF, 12) is strangled to death in Port Orange, FL
Married the hair stylist he was dating.
Linda Hamilton (WF, 16) found drowned to death
Emily Branch (WF, 21) is found dead
Susan Bickrest (WF, 24) is strangled to death in Volusia County, FL
Began drinking heavily again and physically abusing his wife.
Nancy Heard found dead
Bonnie Jean Hughes (WF, 34) is bludgeoned to death in Polk County, FL
Cheryl Ramona Neal (WF, 18) found dead.
Wife files for divorce.  He moves back in with his parents and a month later thecourt grants his wife the divorce.
Susan Bickrest found dead
Joan Gail Foster (WF, 18) is shot to death in Pasco County, FL
Mary Kathleen Muldoon (WF, 23) found shot to death in Daytona Beach, FL
Sandra Dubose (WF, 34) is shot to death in Brevard County
Bonnie Hughes, Diana Valleck, Emily Branch, Christina Goodson, PhoebeWinston, Joan Foster, Susan Basile, and Sandra Dubose found dead.
Phoebe Winston (WF, 25) is shot to death in Polk County, FL
Christine Goodson (BF, 17) is killed in Pinellas County, FL
Dorothy Williams (WF, 17) found stabbed to death in Tampla, FL
Toni Van Haddocks (WF, 26) goes missing
Mary Carol Maher (WF, 20) found stabbed at Daytona Airport

Donna Hensley identifies Stano as having stabbed her.-report made at Daytona Beach Police Dept.-she was picked up by a guy in a red gremlin-he cut her thigh in hotel room when she insisted he pay up front for sex.  Shereceived 27 stitches.  After cutting her he berated her for being a prostitute.-officer spotted the car near crime scene, ran the tags, and it came back that Stanowas the owner.-he had a wrap sheet already, was the prime suspect in several assaults onprostitutes and was positively ID by the victim

Police bring Stano in for questioning relating to a attack on a prostitute.  Duringthis interrogation Stano confessed to assaulting the prostitute.  Later during thissame interrogation he confessed to the murder of Mary Carol Maher.- stabbed Maher because she rejected his sexual advances- stabbed her repeatedly in the chest and then in the back for messing up hiscar by bleeding on it- her body is found posed, lying on her back and covered with branches
Signed a confession to her murder, was charged with 1st degree murder, and putin jail.
Toni Van Haddock’s body is found near Daytona Beach.  She had been stabbedmultiple times in the head
Stano confessed to the murder of Toni Van Haddock

Stano pleads guilty to the murders of Mary Carol Maher, Toni Van Haddocks,and Nancy Heard and is sentenced to life in prison.  Stano also admits tomurdering Ramona Neel, Lynda Hamilton, and the unidentified victim but is notcharged for these three murders

While he is in Florida State Prison. Becomes angry he didn't receive enoughattention for his murders and confesses to more─Scharf, Bickrest, Muldoon,Ligotino, Arceneau, Baur, unidentified woman, Hughes, Valleck, Branch,Goodson, Winston, Foster, Basile, DuBose, and Williams.
Pleads guilty to Bickrest and Muldoon deaths.   Waived right to trial.  The samejudge as before sentenced him to death.

Convicted of Cathy Lee Sharf's murder. Given death penalty by jury. Confessestomore victims over the next three years, but it is not known if they are alltrue or just ones he heard of. No further charges filed
Conviction and sentence were confirmed on appeal
Death warrant signed, he appeals
Granted a stay of execution.
Second death warrant signed, he appeals.  Execution date set for August 26,1987.
Stano files for Writ for Habeas Corpus.  Claimed ineffective counsel.  Granted astay of execution.  Lost the appeal.
Third death warrant signed by Governor of Florida.  Date set for April 29, 1997

Files third appeal, again related to his counsel.  Execution pushed back to May30, 1997.  Before his execution the electric chair malfunctions during theexecution of Pedro Media.  Courts had to stay Stano’s execution until issuesconcerning the electric chair were resolved.
Sentenced to death by the electric chair. Confessed to 41 victims.
